messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: OT:The Anti-unschooler
messages.msgSnippet: She wasn t out $177 -- she hadn t bought the champagne, it was a gift.  And how long ago (if ever) did she pay $51 for the bugle? Had the bugle been
messages.messageBody:
She wasn't out $177 -- she hadn't bought the champagne, it was a gift. And how long ago (if ever) did she pay $51 for the bugle? Had the bugle been played/used/enjoyed for a period of time worth $51? I'll bet it had been quite used, or it would have been much easier to re-sell it to her local music store or pawn shop for more than $50. Sounds to me like they were only out $6 for beer.

Sadly, this sounds like just the kind of thing my Mom would have done, and like my sister would at least consider in her parenting. I remember my Mom destroying my sister's collectible knick-knacks once after sis accidentally (carelessly)broke something of Mom's.

It's just a parent having a tantrum and being vindictive. It won't teach any valuable lessons, but it will destroy any last shred of trust and respect the child had for his parents.

Or maybe it's all just a made-up story designed to bring in higher bids from people who would feel a parent is justified in behaving in such a way. blech.

Syl





She is more concerned with the fact that she was out $177 than the fact that her 13 year old son was drinking all weekend. Poor kid.

messages.subject: RE: OT:The Anti-unschooler
messages.msgSnippet: **but from what I have seen, the bottles do not come with a cork nor do they need a corkscrew to open.  Anyone know?** The last bottle of really expensive
messages.messageBody:
**but from what I have seen, the bottles do not come with a cork nor do
they need a corkscrew to open.  Anyone know?**

The last bottle of really expensive champagne we opened had a cork cork, not
the plastic ones shaped to look like a real cork champagne cork. A 13yo
probably wouldn't know not to use a corkscrew on a champagne cork, and using one on
it would really screw it up.

Deborah in IL


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] OT:The Anti-unschooler
messages.msgSnippet: This auction has been around for quite a while. James spotted it about a month or more ago. My thought is that that misguided mother is removing the one thing
messages.messageBody:
This auction has been around for quite a while. James spotted it about a
month or more ago.

My thought is that that misguided mother is removing the one thing that is
likely to encourage her son to stay home for any part of his free time. She
won't have to lock her liquor cabinet since the boy will be at his friends'
houses from now on instead.

Robyn L. Coburn

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: OT:The Anti-unschooler
messages.msgSnippet: Not only that - I don t think you could open it with a corkscrew.  I wonder if the whole thing is made up - a la the wedding dress auction. If true, sick and
messages.messageBody:
Not only that - I don't think you could open it with a corkscrew. I wonder if the whole thing is made up - a la the wedding dress auction.

If true, sick and sad. If made-up, still pretty sick.

-Cat
----- Original Message -----
From: Jon and Rue Kream
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, July 16, 2004 8:42 PM
Subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Re: OT:The Anti-unschooler


You don't need a corkscrew to open a bottle of Dom. ~Rue

messages.subject: Re: OT:The Anti-unschooler
messages.msgSnippet: I loved the part where she states that parents are smarter than children so they should pay attention.  She has a lot of growing to do herself.  Not to mention
messages.messageBody:
I loved the part where she states that parents are smarter than
children so they should pay attention. She has a lot of growing to
do herself. Not to mention she could use a little practice with
spelling and grammar. :)

Tina

messages.subject: Re: OT:The Anti-unschooler
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, champagne comes with a cork (plastic cork for cheaper brands...)...but it s the kind you pop off, not use the corkscrew for.  Perhaps he didn t know this
messages.messageBody:
Yes, champagne comes with a cork (plastic cork for cheaper
brands...)...but it's the kind you pop off, not use the corkscrew
for. Perhaps he didn't know this and that is why it had half a
cork. Sad that she is more concerned with her $150 bottle of
champagne than the dignity and well being of her son. She is more
concerned with the fact that she was out $177 than the fact that her
13 year old son was drinking all weekend. Poor kid.
